Intro.p: Indicates the operational status of an organisation.

Value.Description: SIF AU uses the term ‘Pending’

Intro.p: Code set denoting the reasons the operational status of an organisation may change.

Value.Text: Ministry Withdrawal of Licence Due to Non-compliance
Merger of State Schools - Forced by Minister
Changed Type or Number, or Became a Composite School
Closure of State School - Forced by Minister
Closure - Voluntary of State or Private School
Tertiary Education Provider that is taken over in a merger

Intro.p: A summary description of the gender of students that a school accepts, indicating the type of school from a gender perspective.

CodeSet.Intro: Regions of New Zealand defined by Ministry of Education for administrative purposes.

Value.Text: Whakatū, Te Tau Ihu o te Waka-a-Māui, Te Tai Poutini
Whakatū/Te Tau Ihu o te Waka-a-Māui/Te Tai Poutini

CodeSet.Intro: Special Education district a provider may belong to

Value.Text: Whakatū, Te Tau Ihu o te Waka-a-Māui, Te Tai Poutini

CodeSet.Intro: Describes the organisation type of the provider, indicating the services provided, function or purpose of the organisation.

Intro.p: Describes the roles for organisations within the education sector, e.g. School Sector Institution, Learnign Support Cluster, etc.

A standardised method of describing a communication channel used to communicate with or find information about a party. Provides a more generic definition than phone and email. Intended to provide for future requirements to record social network channels, eg Facebook & Twitter identifiers for a school.

Value.Description: Typically refers to the home page for an entity
Twitter handle
Facebook page

Intro.p: A standardised method of describing how (or when) a communication channel may be used to communicate with a party. Where a party has more than one electronic contact type (eg several phone numbers), this provides context for deciding which to use. A communication usage type may apply to a phone number, email address or generic communication channel.

Value.Description: Allows the school to decide which of a caregiver's communication channels is to be used when reporting a medical incident occuring to the learner.
Allows the school to decide which of a caregiver's communication channels is to be used when sending an SMS (TXT) message.
Allows the school to decide which of a caregiver's communication channels is to be used when reporting a learner's unexplained absence.
Allows the caregiver to decide which of a school's communication channels is to be used when notifying of a learner's intended absence.

Intro.p: The role played by a person in an organisation where that person is recorded as a contact. The role definition is used to recognise similar functions across organisations, however individuals with the same role may be given different position titles that differ from the generic role description. For example, a principal may have a title of ‘headmaster’.
A policy that a school may choose to implement as part of its operating rules. For example, policies may concern student behaviour, clothing/appearance, wellbeing and new entrant enrolment.

Value.Description: Indicates that new starters will start on the next school day following their 5 birthday.
Indicates that new starters will start in a cohort group only on specific notified dates after their 5th birthday.

CodeSet.Intro: The authority by which the provider is authorised to provide education services. Describes the ownership/operation or registration status of an educational institution.

Value.Description: Also known as 'State: Non-Integrated'
Owned by another organisation, funded from Vote Education.

Intro.p: Code set denoting the classifications that can be given to a school.

Value.Text: Contributing with Year 7 and 8 Bilingual Students

Intro.p: Code set denoting if the school has boarding and if so, if it is for girls only, boys only or both.
A description of the gender of students that the school accepts at a certain year level or other instructional grouping.
For use at the year level or course only, rather than school level. For instance a school may accept boys only in year 11 but both girls and boys at years 12 and 13.
Codes denoting the nature of an Early Childhood Education service.
Code set denoting the type of ECE Service Provider ownership, e.g. Sole Trader, Company, Charitable Trust etc.
A code describing the nature of the relationship between a pair of Organisations.

Value.Description: Source Provider sends learners to the related Provider for the provision of some classes. Exact student and class details will be recorded in co-enrolment flavour of StudentProviderEnrolment.
Source Provider contributes learners to the related Provider, once the learners have completed education at the source Provider.
Source Provider is a Teen Parent Unit which is operated as part of the related Provider. Learners who are also parents attend classes at both the Teen Parent Unit and the host school.

Source Provider is an Activity Centre which is operated as part of the related Provider. Learners who have been identified as being at risk of disengaging from mainstream Schooling attend classes at both the Activity Centre and the host school.

Intro.p: Code set denoting the role the source organisation is playing in this relationship.
Code set denoting the role the related organisation is playing in this relationship.

Value.Description: Role applies to School/ECE's membership of Learning Support Cluster
Role applies to School/ECE's membership of Learning Support Cluster
Role applies to School/ECE's membership of Learning Support Cluster
Role applies to School/ECE's membershp of Kāhui Ako
Role applies to School/ECE's membershp of Kāhui Ako
Role applies to School/ECE's membershp of Kāhui Ako
Role applies to School/ECE's membershp of Kāhui Ako
Role applies to School/ECE's membershp of Kāhui Ako
Role applies to School/ECE's membershp of Kāhui Ako
Role applies to School/ECE's membershp of RTLB Cluster
Role applies to School/ECE's membershp of RTLB Cluster

Intro.p: Describes the role a staff member has at a Provider or other EducationOrganisation.
Describes the status of a staff member's assignment at a Provider or other EducationOrganisation.
Provides the means of identifying the type of group such as Roll class, Subject class or Homeroom and allows systems to treat them accordingly

Value.Description: The TeachingGroup is a class only used for taking daily attendance.
The TeachingGroup is a class only used for teaching.
The TeachingGroup is a class used for both teaching and roll taking.

Intro.p: Code set denoting the role the staff member is performing within the teaching group, e.g. Teacher, Teacher Aide, Student Teacher.
